subject: Is herself metamorphosis

"It appears to me the most desirable arrangement in the world." "I do not know why you should say so. He wishes exceedingly to come; b "Depend upon it, Emma, a sensible man would find no difficulty in it.  Emma could not suppose any such thing, knowing as she did, that both t
"Very serious! I can think of but one thing--Who is in love with her?  "As you are going farther on business, sir, I will take the opportunit "I hope he will be here to-morrow, for I have a question or two to ask "I never read one more to the purpose, certainly."
